TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SkewTransform extends System.Windows.Media.Transform

remarks.format:
## Remarks A SkewTransform is useful for creating the illusion of 3-dimensional depth in a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] object.
**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the SkewTransform class provides several special features: SkewTransform objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 angleX, float64 angleY) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX%2A> property.
The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and is centered on the origin.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkewTransform (double angleX, double angleY, double centerX, double centerY);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 angleX, float64 angleY, float64 centerX, float64 centerY) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX%2A> property.
The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY%2A> property.
The x-coordinate of the transform center. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX%2A> property.
The y-coordinate of the transform center. For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and center.
Gets or sets the x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.
Docs.value: The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To skew an object in place, set the and properties to the object's center point. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable copy of this by making deep copies of its values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable deep copy of the current object. The <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property of the cloned object returns even if the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property of the source is

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects. For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
When this method copies dependency properties, it copies resource references and data bindings although they might no longer resolve. It does not copy animations or their current values.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform CloneCurrentValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable copy of this object by making deep copies of its values. This method does not copy resource references, data bindings, or animations, although it does copy their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable deep copy of the current object. The <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property of the cloned object is even if the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property of the source is .
